messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] About the Shinsengumi! DVD Box set
messages.msgSnippet: The price sounds about right for Japanese DVDs =/....especially a box set in a nice package with extras. ~Okita ... From: sherlgirl To: SHQ@yahoogroups.com
messages.messageBody:
The price sounds about right for Japanese DVDs =/....especially a box set in a nice package with extras.

~Okita

----- Original Message -----
From: sherlgirl
To: SHQ@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, March 17, 2005 5:52 PM
Subject: Re: [SHQ] About the Shinsengumi! DVD Box set


At 08:15 PM 3/17/2005, you wrote:
>Is this for real? I stumbled onto this site:
>
><http://www.cdjapan.co.jp/detailview.html?KEY=GNBD-7145>http://www.cdjapan.co.jp/detailview.html?KEY=GNBD-7145
>
>...and could please someone tell me that they just made a typo on the price? Not even the LotR extended edition is that expensive... -_-;;;
>

At Yesasia.com it is listed for 299.99. (Note these are all region 2 DVDs.)

Kaneyoshi - this drama is also currently available off Bittorrent at d-addicts.com. These fansubs were captured off the West Coast airing (which is subtitled). They're at 48 of 49 episodes at this point.

S

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] About the Shinsengumi! DVD Box set
messages.msgSnippet: *sniff* I don t live in the United States like you fine people. And here, for that price, I can almost buy a new computer... or downpayment for a car... or a
messages.messageBody:
*sniff* I don't live in the United States like you fine people. And here, for that price, I can almost buy a new computer... or downpayment for a car... or a P20,000-worth heart attack. x_x

Is there anywhere else where we can get it cheaper?



K.



Warg3791@... wrote:
O.O -falls over from price-shock-

Unfortunately that is probably right. I know that the Shinsengumi Keppuroku
series is around $160+ and it's not nearly so long as the NHK drama. Perhaps if
I sell a kidney....

-MissB

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Bad Information (and Link)
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for the link. We can only hope the series will be resumed sometime in the future. -sob- And I wanted to see PMK Hijikata with short hair and a western
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for the link. We can only hope the series will be resumed sometime in
the future. -sob- And I wanted to see PMK Hijikata with short hair and a
western suit! They could at least try to console us with releasing the first
PeaceMaker stories here...

This is actually why I hate anything that comes in a series. It ALWAYS seems
to stop without actually finishing the story.

-MissB


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Bad Information (and Link)
messages.msgSnippet: In reference to the news about Peacemaker Kurogane ending after Volume 5, here is a link to an English-language Comic Blade page that discusses it.
messages.messageBody:
In reference to the news about Peacemaker Kurogane ending after Volume
5, here is a link to an English-language Comic Blade page that
discusses it.

http://www.livejournal.com/community/comic_blade/

It may be a vain hope, but perhaps this "break" will not be a
permanent one.

And if I have one other wish, it's for some of the Shinsengumi
dramatizations (e.g. NHK's "Shinsengumi!") to be available in R1.
